job_description:
All required qualifications must be documented on application materials

Required Qualifications:
1. High school diploma/GED and four years of general accounts transaction experience. Training may be substituted for some of the years of experience.
2. Experience in a billing office.
3. Demonstrated/documented understanding of Explanation of Benefits (EOB) required as cash applications serves as a primary resource in reporting trends or incorrect reimbursement.
4. Demonstrated ability to multi-task, organize tasks and prioritize
5. Demonstrated high-level oral and written communications skills to work with patients, staff, providers, and insurance companies
6. Demonstrated excellent customer service skills
7. Demonstrated ability to work with patients and staff from diverse cultures, languages, and backgrounds
8. Demonstrated capacity to work on a team and make positive contributions to the team
9. Demonstrated strong attention to detail
10. Willingness to perform to company standards of compliance with policies and procedures
11. Demonstrated/documented knowledge of insurance verification, coordination of benefits, billing practices and insurance collections

Preferred Qualifications:
1. Knowledge of Epic EMR
2. Post-secondary education credits in business or healthcare
3. Fluency in one of CUHCC’s predominant patient languages (Spanish, Somali, Vietnamese, Lao, Hmong)
4. Knowledge of Federally Qualified Health Care Center (FQHC)
5. Some experience working remotely
**A negative TB test is required for this position.

OBJECTIVE/OVERVIEW:
Hybrid remote & on-site position

CUHCC’s mission is transforming care and education to advance health equity. The clinic is known for providing high quality care to diverse patients and is moving forward in improving timely access to care for patients. This position will focus on cash application. This position will also work as a resource for patients, providers, interpreters and clinic staff within the billing department for medical, dental and mental health.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Position overview and functions may change as position develops

1) Cash Applications: (70%)
a) Responsible for application and reconciliation of all payment and denial files, electronic and manual, received from the insurance or patient. Reconciliation includes the daily lockbox and payments received directly at the clinic.
b) Must be able to read and understand Explanation of Benefits in order to report trends or issues to the supervisor and/or team members.
c) Accurate work queue transfer or next party responsibility transfers and billing of copays, coinsurance, deductible, spend-down, and non-covered services to patient or third party insurance.
d) Outbound calls to the insurance on missing remittances or incomplete imported electronic files.
e) Responsible for recording accurate daily lockbox deposit and manual payment/denial files via Excel including tracking forward balance or withholdings by insurance.
f) Cross-train with Manager on processing of biweekly Minnesota Medicaid remittance advice.

Other job duties: (20%)
a) Responsible for tracking, image scanning and storage of all correspondence received through lockbox, imported files, or internally.
b) Continuous process improvement on workflows keeping manuals and written workflows updated with changes or new processes.
c) Review and respond to all correspondence received via mail or internally routed. Work with HIM and prepare billing record documentation as necessary.
d) Attend team and company-wide meetings as well as one-on-one’s with supervisor
e) This role will be included in the billing team phone queue to assist patients with any billing questions, statements, and collecting payment.
f) Provide patients, providers and clinic staff with explanation of account balances, payment history and insurance coverage as related to medical, dental and mental health departments
g) This position may be included in a rotation to report to the clinic at the billing desk and will need to understand the processes and workflows. The billing role at the clinic is responsible for professionalism and courteousness to patients and clinic staff, accepting payments, waiver review, estimated treatment costs, and questions on account.
h) Cross-train with Credit Review Specialist as backup
i) Responsible to manage hours, vacation and sick time

3) Other duties as assigned: (10%)

Hourly Salary Range: $20.23 - $28.45

CUHCC serves nearly 11,000 patients a year through over 55,000 visits annually. The patient population comes from over 12 different racial and ethnic groups that span five continents. CUHCC’s mission is to seek health equity in our community by advancing the well-being of diverse people. Candidates must be able to adapt behaviors to others’ styles; interact with people who have different values, cultures, or backgrounds; be of service to difficult people; optimize the benefits of having a diverse workforce.

Teamwork is an essential skill to promote synergy within the organization. Candidates must be able to share due credit with coworkers; display enthusiasm and promote a friendly group working environment; work closely with other departments as necessary; support group decisions and solicit opinions from coworkers; display team spirit.

Candidates must have excellent communication skills and be able to clearly present information through the spoken or written word; read and interpret complex information; talk with customers or clients; listen well.

Staff is expected to demonstrate a high level of service delivery; do what is necessary to ensure customer satisfaction; deal with service failures and prioritize customer needs.

Applications must be submitted online. To be considered for this position, please click the Apply button and follow the instructions. You will have the opportunity to complete an online application for the position and attach a cover letter and resume.

Additional documents may be attached after application by accessing your "My Job Applications" page and uploading documents in the "My Cover Letters and Attachments" section.

To request an accommodation during the application process, please e-mail employ@umn.edu or call (612) 624-UOHR (8647).

The University recognizes and values the importance of diversity and inclusion in enriching the employment experience of its employees and in supporting the academic mission. The University is committed to attracting and retaining employees with varying identities and backgrounds.

The University of Minnesota provides equal access to and opportunity in its programs, facilities, and employment without regard to race, color, creed, religion, national origin, gender, age, marital status, disability, public assistance status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, or gender expression. To learn more about diversity at the U: http://diversity.umn.edu.

Any offer of employment is contingent upon the successful completion of a background check. Our presumption is that prospective employees are eligible to work here. Criminal convictions do not automatically disqualify finalists from employment.

Please note: All employees at the University of Minnesota are required to report complete vaccination against COVID-19 or submit documentation requesting a medical or religious exemption on their first day of employment. To learn more, please visit the University's COVID-19 Response webpage.

The University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMTC)

The University of Minnesota, Twin Cities (UMTC), is among the largest public research universities in the country, offering undergraduate, graduate, and professional students a multitude of opportunities for study and research. Located at the heart of one of the nation's most vibrant, diverse metropolitan communities, students on the campuses in Minneapolis and St. Paul benefit from extensive partnerships with world-renowned health centers, international corporations, government agencies, and arts, nonprofit, and public service organizations.

job_description:
Liberty Mutual's Corporate Legal Services Team is seeking an experienced corporate transaction attorney to handle challenging and interesting corporate law assignments such as corporate and alternative financing matters, private equity/venture investments, mergers & acquisitions, and corporate governance issues operating under minimal supervision. Generally, has at least eight years` experience as a practicing lawyer. Provides legal advice and carries out actions which have an impact upon the rights, privileges and responsibilities of the Company while maintaining high standards of legal and business ethics and professional responsibility.
Overview:
A highly qualified attorney who may be a specialist or highly experienced generalist who handles with minimal supervision complex legal assignments primarily focused on a broad variety of corporate transactions including financing matters such as note offerings, hybrid transactions, loan agreements, lines of credit, and alternative financing vehicles; venture and private equity matters generally; mergers & acquisitions; general corporate law and governance matters and other strategic corporate law-based projects. Generally has at least eight years` experience as a practicing lawyer. Provides legal advice and carries out actions which have an impact upon the rights, privileges and responsibilities of the Company while maintaining high standards of legal and business ethics and professional responsibility.
Responsibilities:
Provides high quality oral and written legal advice in a cost-effective manner to internal clients.
Recommends practical courses of action to achieve client goals within the scope of what is legally permissible.
Performs comprehensive research and analysis of reported cases, statutes, regulations and other legal materials regarding issues often characterized by an absence of clear legal precedent and renders clear and unambiguous legal opinions and advice as necessary.
Represents clients in complex legal and business transactions with a particular focus on a variety of corporate transactional matters including financing matters such as note offerings, hybrid transactions, loan agreements, lines of credit, and alternative financing vehicles; venture and private equity matters generally; mergers & acquisitions; general corporate law and governance matters; and other strategic corporate law-based projects, generally with minimal supervision, where the facts, the law or the precedents involved can be interpreted differently or are in dispute.
Representative duties include: Drafting, reviewing and negotiating legal documents related to the noted corporate transactional matters (e.g. confidentiality agreements, nonbinding offers/letters of intent, purchase & sales agreements, closing documentation, offering memorandums, loan agreements, letters of credit, and other specialized and related capital finance, private equity and venture focused documentation) involving substantial legal issues; Corporate governance, due diligence investigations, research, drafting, advising, and managing outside counsel in connection with any of the above matters; Representing the Company before regulatory and administrative bodies; Providing advice regarding the implications of new laws substantially impacting the Company`s business; and Anticipating legal issues and encouraging practices to prevent problems from arising.
May assign, direct and review (but not manage) the work of attorneys, law clerks and paralegals
May prepare and conduct training sessions for internal clients.
Maintains current knowledge of legal issues and developments in the law.
Cross-training on related matters such as insurance regulatory, reinsurance, capital markets, and other duties is expected.
Requirements include excellent oral and written communication skills, client focus, managing projects and multiple priorities, attention to detail and demonstrated ability to conduct research and analysis of legal issues. Within certain practice groups, may require in-depth knowledge of a specialized area of law. Completion of law school with a J.D. or L.L.B. degree and admission to the bar of at least one jurisdiction in the United States required. Generally requires at least five years` experience as a practicing attorney.

summary: As a Process Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring process equipment is maintained and applied to operate at maximum efficiency and drives continuous…
job_description:
As a Process Engineer, you will be responsible for ensuring process equipment is maintained and applied to operate at maximum efficiency and drives continuous improvement to increase efficiency of manufacturing processes. You will also work with members of the technical department on new product scale-ups and modification of existing processes to ensure consistency of product.
The Process Engineer will support the newly acquired PMC Plant in Kansas City, Kansas.
Key Responsibilities
Provide a safe and healthy work environment for all employees through proper maintenance of equipment and facilities and elimination of health hazards to prevent work stoppage and time loss due to accidents, while ensuring alignment to all applicable environmental, health and safety laws, standards and policies
Perform all engineering phases of plant projects from project conception to implementation
Support facility Quality certifications by maintaining operating procedures of all manufacturing equipment and coordinating equipment calibrations
Use good engineering practices to ensure that process equipment is properly maintained and applied to operate at maximum efficiency
Qualifications
Bachelor’s Degree in engineering (Chemical or Mechanical) or equivalent technical work experience is required.
Strong problem solving/troubleshooting skills and a wide range of general mechanical experience/knowledge are critical to success on the job.
Must have strong planning and organizing skills to optimally lead daily maintenance tasks and projects at the facility
Previous project management experience is required

job_description:
The Department
Exiciting opportunity to join the Office of Transportation that is comprised of a staff of 15 team members that are responsible for transportation planning, transportation programs, and the City's transportation infrastructure. The Office of Transportation's mission is to preserve and enhance the quality of life for Palo Alto residents, visitors, and businesses by providing efficient and cost-effective transportation services for all modes of transportation. The department is also responsible for parking management and operations, traffic operations, bikeways development, area transportation studies, regional transit/transportation coordination, and the soon to be coming; On Demand transit system.

The Position
This position provides direct complex administrative support to the Chief Transportation Official (CTO) and the department as a whole. This position may also provide support to boards and commission and take minutes at a variety of meetings. The successful candidate will need to manage a high volume of calls that will require a working knowledge of the organization and programs and maintain effective interpersonal skills to successfully provide the high level of customer service that will be expected in this role. The chosen candidate will be experienced in evaluating demands on the Chief Transportation Official's time and arrange schedules accordingly.

Ideal Candidate
The ideal candidate will be a seasoned administrative assistant who is a skilled communicator with strong organizational skills and sound independent judgment to be responsible for performing complex administrative tasks. The chosen candidate will have the ability to maintain confidentiality; understand, interpret, and apply appropriate rules, regulations and written directions to specific situations. Additionally, the candidate will assist the department, staff, boards, commissions and the general public in situations requiring tact and poise to deliver a high level of customer service.

 To review the full job description, go here
Essential Duties
Essential and other important responsibilities and duties may include, but are not limited to, the following:
Leads, plans and coordinates the administrative, technical, and analytical tasks in support of the department head.
 Serves as a primary resource point for City employees, Council members, Board and Commission members, committees and Task Force, citizens or visitors, answering complex questions regarding policy, procedural, informational or technical inquiries, requiring a thorough knowledge of City and department programs, functions, organizational structure, as well as the use of independent judgment and discretion in the release of confidential or sensitive information.
Create and update information on the internet and intra-net. Relieves department head, of certain administrative matters by following up on projects, transmitting information and keeping managers informed of department activities.
Leads, plans and coordinates the administrative, technical, and analytical tasks in support the CTO.

The future you want is within reach.

summary: We are looking for you, who has experience with complex fault tolerant mechanical, software, electronic, chemical, thermal systems integration.
job_description:
We are looking for you, who has experience with complex fault tolerant mechanical, software, electronic, chemical, thermal systems integration. Ideally, we would like to find someone who has significant experience in systems engineering and can help guide the team through the nuances of complex system design and integration pitfalls. You have not just maintained/made incremental improvements to an existing architecture, but rather are comfortable going from vague initial requirements, interfaces definition and control, xFMEA, integration, and product V&V, while hopping between multiple projects. Experience in the space field is not required, though candidates with experience in chemical, automotive, aviation, maritime, subsea, or mission critical industries are encouraged to apply.
Duties & Responsibilities:
Generate and maintain SE&I modeling and documentation, including but not limited to: the System Breakdown Structure (SBS), concept of operations, requirements analysis, use cases, behavior diagrams, trade studies, system architecture, Interface Control Documents, risk analysis, integration and verification plans
Evaluate customer/operational needs to define system performance level requirements, integrating technical parameters, and assuring compatibility of physical, functional, and program interfaces
Generate, review, approve, and manage system requirements — including but not limited to regulatory, safety, design, environmental, manufacturing, quality, operational, and testing reqs.
Generate, review, approve, and manage subsystem interfaces and interactions within Interface Control Documents (ICDs)— including but not limited to physical, thermal, electric, data interactions.
Lead informal and formal system design reviews and fault tolerance analysis/failure mode, effects, and criticality analysis (DFMEA/FMECA)
Manage technical risks, cross functional issues, and mitigation actions
Execute prototype and product integration plans, including overall product build and testing, including V&V and requirement verification matrix maintenance
Ensure the system solutions are flight worthy prior to test ops
Identify scope creep and inform the project manager. Work with the team on system optimization.
Manage the configuration management process
 Required Skills/Experience:
3+ years of engineering/product development experience, including 2+ years of demonstrated proficiency and leadership in systems engineering.
Good working knowledge of multiple engineering disciplines, including Mechanical, Chemical, Electrical, and Software Engineering.
Desired Skills/Experience:
An understanding of chemical reactors design and operations
Understands what is — and what is not — needed for high reliability VTVL systems
Experience with the complete lifecycle of a program: design, build, test, and fly
Experience using AS9145 and AS1300x standards
Experience with DO-278 or DO-178 certifications
Experience with Aerospace Systems Safety
Professional Requirements:
Applicants must be legally authorized to work in the United States. An applicant who is not a "U.S. person," as that term is defined in U.S. export control regulations (22 CFR §120.15), must be eligible for authorization from the U.S. Department of Commerce and/or the U.S. Department of State to receive hardware and/or technical information controlled under the Export Administration Regulations, 15 CFR 730–774, and/or the International Traffic in Arms Regulation, 22 CFR §§ 120–130. Offers to non-U.S. persons may be contingent upon authorization from the Department of Commerce and/or the Department of State to access controlled information.

Performs a variety of accounting duties involved in processing, reconciling, and documenting the payroll function.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS
Essential functions are the basic job duties that an employee must be able to perform, with or without reasonable accommodation. The list of essential functions, as outlined herein, is intended to be representative of the tasks performed within this classification. The omission of a function does not preclude management from assigning essential duties not listed herein if such duties relate to the position.

Performs related work as required

High School Degree or G.E.D. equivalency
Three (3) to five (5) years of experience in payroll processing or accounting.
Associate’ degree is preferred.

Special Requirements:
Essential Employees may be required to work during a declared emergency. The employee’s Department Head will determine who will be required to work.

PHYSICAL STANDARDS REQUIRED TO PERFORM ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:

 The position is generally sedentary. Employees sit most of the time, but may walk or stand for brief periods of time. The position involves light physical demands, such as exerting up to 20 lbs. of force occasionally, and/or up to 10 lbs. of force frequently, and/or a negligible amount of force constantly to move objects.

HOW TO APPLY/ VETERAN INFORMATION
Depending on the number of applications and the quality of their education and experience, the examination may consist of one or more of the following tests: Evaluation of Training and Experience, Oral Interview, Written Examination, or other assessment method. Applicants must attain a minimum score of 70 in each part of the examination in order to qualify. All successful applicants will be required to pass a medical examination, including drug screening, prior to appointment.

An eligible veteran who enters an open-competitive examination shall receive preference points added to the total passing score earned in the examination as provided for in the Florida Statutes. To obtain veteran's preference, candidates MUST submit a copy of separation papers and the City of Fort Lauderdale's veteran's preference claim form (J-204) (Download PDF reader).
The City of Fort Lauderdale is AN EQUAL EMPLOYMENT OPPORTUNITY (EEO) AND AFFIRMATIVE ACTION EMPLOYER. All applicants receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender (including identity or expression), marital status, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability or any other protected classification as defined by applicable law (except as limited by Personnel Rules, Collective Bargaining Agreements, or bona fide occupational qualifications).

In compliance with the Drug-Free Workplace Act of 1988, the City of Fort Lauderdale is committed to providing a safe, quality-oriented and productive work environment consistent with the standards of the community in which it serves. Alcohol and drug abuse pose a threat to the health and safety of City’s employees and to the security of the City’s equipment and facilities. For these reasons, the City is committed to the elimination of drug and alcohol use and abuse in the workplace.

Title I of the Americans with Disabilities Act (ADA) protects qualified individuals with disabilities from employment discrimination. Under the ADA, a person has a disability if he has a physical or mental impairment that substantially limits a major life activity.The physical demands described within the job description are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. In compliance with the ADA, the City of Fort Lauderdale will provide reasonable accommodations to qualified individuals with disabilities and encourages both prospective and current employees to discuss potential accommodations with the employer.
The City of Fort Lauderdale offers a comprehensive benefits package to all regular full-time employees including vacation, holiday, and sick leave as well as medical, dental, vision, life and short-term disability insurance.

job_description:
The Crisis Chat Specialist is responsible for providing online emotional support to individuals utilizing Crisis Chat and Text services and to provide crisis intervention, emotional support, intervention, and resources to all contacts. Specialists will receive around 45 hours of training related to active listening skills, suicide prevention practices, and utilization of agency resources to match texters with needed information. The Crisis Chat Specialist would provide and assure critical coverage between the hours of 3:00 am and 12:00 pm (EST). Position has the potential to be performed remotely. Remote staff must reside in either the District of Columbia, Maryland or Virginia.
Required Qualifications

High School Diploma or GED required; some college desirable.
Previous experience in crisis intervention, counseling or psychology background is preferred.
Strong verbal and written communication skills.
Skilled in the use of technology including telephones, computers (PC), laptops, software and email.
Ability to work independently with confidence, as well as work as an integral part of a team of professionals.
Must be mature, sensitive, emotionally stable; flexible and adaptable to varying situations and coverage needs.
Reliable and able to adhere to schedules based upon call center needs.
Ability to consistently adhere to call center program policies and procedures.
Willingness to work flexible hours, including overnight shifts, holidays, weekends and change as needed according to coverage needs.
Successful completion of all call center training.
(For Remote Work - DC, MD, VA residents only) Must have a computer/laptop, high-speed internet and a quiet workspace


Essential Responsibilities

Respond to crisis chats/texts and provide emotional support, assessment, crisis intervention, and treatment/support referrals to individuals in a consistent and non-judgmental manner.
Fill open crisis line shifts on a regular basis and as needed, including weekends, holidays, and overnights to ensure adequate coverage for the lines.
Consistently and accurately assess each texters for suicide risk following assessment protocols and practices; provide adequate and relevant safety/action planning for each texters.
Offer and provide follow up texts and chat to individuals at risk of suicide, suicide loss survivors, and others.
Follow through on imminent risk chats to assure emergency contact is made with texters and confirm outcomes or re-engage texters as indicated.
Provide detailed and thorough documentation for all crisis chats/texts.
Adhere consistently to chat/text management guidelines and all call center policies and procedures.
Maintain confidentiality of all texters
Must participate in all required trainings and meetings.
Utilize supervisory consultation for guidance, support, or debriefing as needed.
Other duties as assigned.


Skills

Proven customer support experience or experience as a client service representative

Familiarity with CRM systems and practices
Customer orientation and ability to adapt/respond to different types of characters
Excellent communication skills
Ability to multi-task, prioritize, and manage time effectively
High school diploma

summary:
Provides a full range of front desk operations in a busy dental care practice.
Provides customer service to patients, families, dentist and staff as needed.
job_description:
Overview


About the Organization

Tower Health is a strong, regional, integrated healthcare provider/payer system that offers leading-edge, compassionate healthcare and wellness services to a population of 2.5 million people. Together, our seven hospitals and other entities provide a full range of medical care from prevention, screenings & education; to the latest clinical services and surgeries available; to rehabilitation. We also offer wellness programs & public health services that ensure our communities are the healthiest they can be. Our caring, highly trained physicians and staff are committed to patient safety and patient satisfaction.

With more than 11,000 team members, Tower Health includes Reading Hospital, a teaching hospital based in West Reading; Brandywine Hospital in Coatesville; Chestnut Hill Hospital, a teaching hospital in Philadelphia; Jennersville Hospital in West Grove; Phoenixville Hospital in Phoenixville; Pottstown Hospital in Pottstown; and St. Christopher's Hospital for Children. We also operate Reading Hospital Rehabilitation at Wyomissing & Reading Hospital School of Health Sciences, & we have a comprehensive physician network.

Collaboration across Tower Health enables our hospitals, providers, leadership & staff to leverage best practices across the health system. Our hospitals have received national recognition for advanced care in areas such as neurosurgery and stroke, cardiac & vascular surgery, trauma, hematology & oncology. Reading HealthPlex, which opened at Reading Hospital in October 2016, combines state-of-the-art technology and world-class design to make the HealthPlex one of the most sophisticated surgical centers & inpatient facilities in the region.

At Tower Health, we have a rich history of providing high-quality, cost-effective care in the communities we serve. As the healthcare industry continues to change, one thing remains steadfast: Tower Health's commitment to Advancing Health, Transforming Lives.

Responsibilities


Job Summary:

Provides a full range of front desk operations in a busy dental care practice.
Provides customer service to patients, families, dentist and staff as needed. Represents image of the practice to patients, community and institution through personal and telephone contact.
Receives, greets patients, family members/visitors, physicians and hospital personnel as appropriate in a friendly and courteous manner.
Answer multiline telephones using appropriate telephone etiquette.
Triage calls, records, communicates and delivers all messages assuring accuracy and timelines.
Schedules and confirms all patient appointments for a high volume practice into the scheduling system.
Will keep the schedule up to date showing proper ratio patients per doctor.
Organizes and prepares charts. Filing of patient charts and information into the dental record.
Registers new patients and updating current patient's information as needed..
Other duties as directed by the manager.
Skills & Abilities:

Excellent customer services and problem solving skills.
Demonstrates initiative and ability to work independently.
Demonstrated good organizational skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Previous computer scheduling experience preferred.
Previous experience working in a fast pace dental practice preferred.
Excellent oral and written communication skills.

Qualifications


Training & Education:

High school graduate or equivalent.
Computer data entries experience a plus.
Some dental terminology preferred.
Experience:

Minimum two years' experience with manual computerized scheduling system and front desk responsibilities in a busy dental practiced preferred.

summary: Understanding of fundamental principles of P2P including spend and commodity taxonomies, requisitioning, PO generation, receiving, matching, invoice processing…
job_description:
Gopuff’s Global Strategic Sourcing and Procurement team is rapidly growing and is seeking a Buyer Operations enthusiast to join the team! This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a team who is building a Procure to Pay (P2P) program to better support Gopuff’s needs. We are looking for an individual who can bring both their buying expertise and customer obsession to help us enhance our P2P processes through systems implementation and stakeholder adoption. This is a unique opportunity to engage with internal partners to transform how Gopuff procures.
#LI-Remote
Responsibilities:
Support adoption of Coupa within the indirect goods and services categories (e.g., requisition creation and approval, purchase order transmittal to the approved supplier as well as associated PO confirmations and change orders)
Serve as the single threaded owner to provide stakeholders with guidance in the development of purchase orders, order processing, and reporting
Support stakeholders with supplier catalog creation and implementation of creative procurement strategies to support unique business needs
Provide day-to-day monitoring and support of the Requisition to PO Process to ensure the smooth flow of submitted POs to suppliers
Support implementation of new business spend management (Coupa) capabilities
Enable user adoption, lead trainings and communications to stakeholders
Help troubleshoot issues that users may have which could be data, process, Coupa configuration or integration related
Capture business needs for Coupa performance and system enhancements
Perform supplier onboarding in partnership with Accounts Payable
Highlight opportunities for utilization of preferred suppliers or supplier consolidation
Identify opportunities for efficiency and automation improvements in Buyer Ops tools / processes
Support change management initiatives and communication to employees and suppliers to better educate on P2P processes
Qualifications:
Bachelor's degree in Accounting, Business or equivalent experience
3+ years purchasing experience
Experience with Procure-to-Pay (P2P) platforms as a heavy end user, implementer, invoice processor, or buyer.
Understanding of fundamental principles of P2P including spend and commodity taxonomies, requisitioning, PO generation, receiving, matching, invoice processing and disbursement.
Proficiency with Coupa system, configuration and ongoing administration tasks
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, evolving, results driven environment
Ability to perform multiple tasks simultaneously, work effectively in a team environment and meet deadlines
Strong communication skills - verbal and writing
Excellent attention to detail and organization
Good at working independently - proactive, self-starter
Benefits
We want to help our employees stay safe and healthy! We offer comprehensive medical, dental, and vision insurance, optional FSAs and HSA plans, 401k, commuter benefits, supplemental employee, spouse and child life insurance to all eligible employees.

We also offer:Gopuff employee discountCareer growth opportunitiesInternal rewards programsAnnual performance appraisal and bonus

At Gopuff, we know that life can be unpredictable. Sometimes you forget the milk at the store, run out of pet food for Fido, or just really need ice cream at 11 pm. We get it—stuff happens. But that’s where we come in, delivering all your wants and needs in just minutes.
And now, we’re assembling a team of motivated people to help us drive forward that vision to bring a new age of convenience and predictability to an unpredictable world.
Like what you’re hearing? Then join us on Team Blue.
Gopuff is an equal employment opportunity employer, committed to an inclusive workplace where we do not discriminate on the basis of race, sex, gender, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital or familial status, age, ancestry, disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable laws. We believe in diversity and encourage any qualified individual to apply.

job_description:
At AGCO, we believe that when our employees succeed, our business succeeds. It’s a people philosophy that we believe and invest in. We make sure all of our employees – in every function, every geography and at every level – have the tools they need to be successful and take charge of their career. Because when our people grow, our business grows. Every day. Every way.

Excellent English written & verbal communication skills

Diversity means many things to us: different brands, cultures, nationalities, gender, generations - even variety in our roles. AGCO benefits from the perspectives, experiences, and ideas that come from our naturally diverse team of 20,000 colleagues in over 35 countries.

summary: If you are looking for a role that allows to you support the recovering economy, do a public good, work in health care, or if you are looking for a job that…
job_description:
Verification Specialist
If you are looking for a role that allows to you support the recovering economy, do a public good, work in health care, or if you are looking for a job that does not require you to do any form of inbound or outbound sales, Verisys is hiring verification specialists. Verisys is looking for a fun, energetic, hardworking, entry-level Verification Specialist to join our ReferencePro team.
As a Verification Specialist, you will work as a part of Verisys' ReferencePro team. In this position, you will make calls to verify references, validate employment and education history on behalf of our health care clients. Our clients count on us to provide a thorough reference check on their potential new hires.
This role will be a work from home-based role during the COVID pandemic. After the pandemic, our plan to have this role remain a work from home role, unless you would prefer to work in the office.

Verisys has a strong focus on people. Throughout the pandemic, we were winners of several workplace culture awards. Energage.com ranked us as a Top Places to Work in the USA. The Salt Lake Tribune ranked us as the #3 medium sized Top Places to Work for in the State of Utah. Utah Business Magazine ranked us as one of the Best Places to Work in the State of Utah. We also won several comparably culture awards as well last year. You can see all of our verifiable employee reviews at Comparably.com. We take great pride in our team and what we accomplish together, and if you feel this might be a great fit for you, we’d love to talk more!
A day in the life:
Complete verification of health care professional's education and employment history
Outbound calls to educational institutions and employers (calls are made to parties that expect these calls—this job does not require cold calling or sales)
Documentation of verification processes
Cross-training to other healthcare provider credentialing verification processes
Work as part of a team to providing best in class customer service and timely results
Willingness and ability to work flexible hours (Overtime is often available)
Maintain a high level of quality and attention to detail
What we are looking for:
Self-starter with strong drive and work ethic
Research and problem solving excites you
Excellent reasoning and analytical skills
Ability to adjust priorities throughout the day
An uncompromising approach to meeting/exceeding daily quality requirements
Excellent customer-first focus
Ability to switch between programs, and user interfaces to collect and document data
Ability to work independently and take initiative (we don't micromanage around here)
Excellent communication skills and the ability to really listen
Someone comfortable with making phone calls to organizations, as needed
Position Requires:
Ability to ask questions and electronically log answers
Reliable high-speed internet at home (minimum 25Mbps connection speed)
Provide a safe and professional office-work environment, free from background noise and distraction
Able to type thirty-five (35) words per minute
Able to work from the Verisys office for meetings and trainings as needed, or if experiencing technical difficulties at home
Understanding some questions might need to be asked twice to get to the truth
Must be 18 years of age or older
Not required but would love to see:
Previous customer service experience is preferred
Experience in data comparison is preferred
Experience in full cycle investigations is preferred
Awesome Benefits:
 Amazing medical, dental, and vision plans – with minimal cost to you Generous Paid Time Off 11 Company Paid Holidays per year Short-Term and Long-term Disability & Company paid Life Insurance 401(k) Plan with Company Match (day 1 vesting)
Company Overview:
Verisys transforms provider data, workforce data, and relationship management. More than 400 healthcare, life science, and background screening organizations depend on us to credential providers, improve data quality, publish compliant provider directories, and conduct employment verifications. Our comprehensive solutions deliver accurate and secure information. As a result, we’re the largest outsourced credentials verification organization in the United States. Since we’ve partnered with the most complex institutions in healthcare for decades, we can help organizations of any size discover their true potential.
At Verisys, you can have a rewarding career on every level. In addition to challenging and meaningful work, you will have the chance to give back to your community, make a positive impact on the environment, participate in a range of diversity and inclusion initiatives, and find the support, coaching, and training it takes to advance your career. Our commitment to individual choice lets you customize aspects of your career path, your educational opportunities, and your benefits. And our culture of innovation means your ideas on how to improve our business and our clients will be heard.

job_description: ORGANIZATIONAL OVERVIEWMAEC was founded in 1991, as an education non-profit dedicated to increasing access to equitable educational opportunities so all children and students can learn and achieve at high levels. Its mission is to promote excellence and equity in education to achieve social justice.MAEC is committed to (1) meeting State Education Agencies( SEA), Local Education Agenties (LEA) and Early Childhood Program program needs; (2) developing exemplary early childhood professionals; (3) fostering the success of all children, youth, and families; and (4) actively developing and promoting innovative, effective, and efficient products, practices and services in order to fulfill these commitments. This is essential work that makes a difference in the lives of children, families, and educators.The MAEC EC Department provides a range of services to educators and systems to promote equity and positive outcomes for young children and their families. All services are based on our foundational commitment to Social Justice, Diversity, Equity and Inclusion, and how to support early learners and their families with culturally responsive practices.POSITION DESCRIPTIONThe Early Childhood (EC) Department seeks accomplished early childhood specialists who believe in MAEC's mission to promote excellence and equity in education to achieve social justice and provide a range of professional development experiences. As an Early Childhood Equity Specialist, you will provide professional development and technical assistance to support State Education Agencies (SEA's), Local Education Agencies (LEA's), and early childhood professionals throughout the country. The specialist will develop content , provide professional development training, technical assistance, coaching, and facilitate communities of practice (CoP), supporting equity in early childhood systems. This position is critical in delivering research-based educational practices that address a wide variety of needs for early childhood professionals. The Early Childhood Specialist will work with the team to develop in-person and online professional learning resources and materials for coaching and Communities of Practice ( CoP).REQUIRED SKILLS· Experience with Microsoft Office (Word, Excel and PowerPoint) required· Experience using virtual platforms and technologies, i.e. Skype, Zoom, Adobe, Teams etc.· Strong analytical, problem-solving and decision-making capabilities· Team player with the ability to work in a fast-paced environment· High comfort level with ambiguity· Ability to work with all levels of internal staff, as well as outside clients and vendors· Clear ability to provide project management on projects, including developing and overseeing budgets, teamwork flows, and quality controlQUALIFICATIONS· A qualified candidate would have a broad understanding of early childhood programs and services and how the early childhood system functions· Bachelor's degree (master's preferred) in child development, early childhood education, or related field· Active interest in Equity, diversity inclusion, and social justice.· The candidate would have a strong understanding of how early childhood system components, such as funding, policy, equitable access, and program implementation, interact with one another at the federal, state, and local levels· Demonstrated ability to articulate and showcase how advancing equity in research is incorporated into research designs, methods, and dissemination strategies.· Subject matter expertise of the complex nature of the early childhood system, such as federal, state, tribal, and local policies and practices related to ECE.· Strong track record of providing technical assistance to state or local entities .· Ability to engage a variety of stakeholders, including policymakers, advocates, practitioners, families, and researchers· Flexibility in managing workflow and accommodating priority activities· Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to develop strong client relationships· Ability to travel, if needed (once COVID-19 restrictions are lifted)COMPENSATION AND BENEFITSCompensation will be commensurate with experience. MAEC offers a competitive benefits package including health, vision, dental insurance, and a 401K retirement program.This can be a remote or hybrid position. If you live in the DC, Maryland, or Virginia area this position may be hybrid depending on your location.TO APPLYFor instruction on how to apply, please visit:https://maec.org/about/job-opportunities/early_childhood_equity_specialist/NO PHONE CALLS.Job Type: Full-timePay: $70,000.00 - $100,000.00 per yearBenefits:Dental insuranceHealth insuranceVision insuranceSchedule:8 hour shiftWork Location: Remote

summary: As a Released Product Engineer, you will support the products that have been developed by QBP’s internal brands including Salsa Cycles, Surly Bikes, All City…
job_description:
As a Released Product Engineer, you will support the products that have been developed by QBP’s internal brands including Salsa Cycles, Surly Bikes, All City Cycles, Whisky Parts Co., and MSW Parts and Accessories. You will develop creative solutions to improve product performance and quality, create new tests and tools for product evaluation, and ensure that our customers have a great experience with our products.
QBP strives to be an extraordinary business and we have made good on that goal for over 40 years. As a values-driven company, making the world a better place is at the heart of everything QBP does. We believe that our actions as individuals and as a company can make a difference, so we work every day to improve the sustainability and health of our industry and our communities.
Everything we do is centered around one basic idea: get more butts on bikes. To do that, we need team members with diverse backgrounds and experiences. We’ll do our best to make this your favorite job ever, how will you bring your energy and engineering to create equity in our world? Our community is passionate about pushing creative boundaries, sparking innovation, creating solutions in our communities, and having fun. QBP employees enjoy rad perks - product discounts, commuting incentives, fitness and wellness programs, flexible schedules, and the ability to bring your dog to work just to name a few.
As a Released Product Engineer, you will have four primary responsibilities:
1) Released Product Design Improvements - 40%
Revise designs or create new components to improve performance or reduce cost for released products.
Collaborate with suppliers to improve manufacturability of released products.
Completing engineering documentation for released products.
Modify engineering models and drawings with SolidWorks. File these drawings appropriately in the engineering PDM system.
Create rapid prototypes in support of product and R&D projects.
Export and store information appropriately in the company-wide documentation system.
Evaluate vendor off-the-shelf products to determine whether they meet QBP Brand requirements.
Properly document off-the-shelf products that will be sold by QBP Brands.
Manage own time to meet product milestones as set by supervisor.
Hold technical reviews on proposed design changes and incorporate feedback into designs.
Collaborate closely with the Design Engineers on assigned projects to ensure changes meet original design intent.
Participate in design reviews, technical reviews, and product discussions with other Design Engineers.
Communicate effectively with domestic and international manufacturers, vendors, suppliers, and sales departments.
2) Product Safety and Quality Assurance - 30%
Investigate root cause for manufacturing issues and customer returns.
Document root cause analysis with test methods and reports.
Evaluate returned products through assembly, ride, and lab testing.
Develop and execute lab tests to duplicate field complaints both independantly and with the support of Test Engineering.
Review any anomalous QC or Batch Test data and recommend appropriate responses to the product team.
Develop tolerance schemes and inspection processes to control the quality of product during production.
Determine necessary qualification and testing measures during iterative product changes.
Test, qualify, and document products within the applicable government regulations and standards and approved test plan.
Monitor and review warranty claims to identify systemic problems.
Support Product Safety and Legal teams with data and documentation as needed.
3) Product Support - 20%
Be a technical resource for customer service agents for proprietary products.
Provide technical input to marketing for the creation of content including instructions, product technical information, concept renderings, or blogs.
Develop knowledge of bicycle component capabilities and compatibilities in order to better understand product use and customer challenges.
4) Research and Development - 10%
Participate in brainstorming and support at least one R&D project per year.
Report R&D results to the engineering team as appropriate.
 And other duties as assigned.
Reporting Structure
You will be an Engineering team member and will report to the Engineering Manager within the QBP Product Engineering department. You’ll complete project work with input from Design Engineering, Product Management, and Industrial Design teams.
Qualifications
1) Primary Qualifications (must-haves):
ABET-accredited Bachelor’s Degree in Mechanical Engineering and/or passing FE exam results.
Strong mechanical problem solving.
Ability to balance competing deadlines and projects with general prioritization set by supervisor.
Ability to thrive in an international work environment and overcome language barriers.
Fluent in Microsoft Office Suite.
Capable in at least one major CAD Software (for example SolidWorks, ProE, CATIA, etc.)
Strong desire for feedback and collaboration on designs and concepts.
0-3 years of engineering experience.
Unrestricted right to work in the USA.
 2) Physical Requirements:
Ability to use the computer extensively.
Ability and/or willingness to learn cycling skills to test products.
Willingness to work outdoors while performing product testing in a variety of conditions including heat, wet, and/or cold.
Ability to travel Internationally and/or domestically 2-6 weeks a year, including travel by plane.
 3) Secondary Qualifications (these could be followed with “is/are a plus.”)
Experience with CAE Analysis, especially SolidWorks Simulation.
Strong CAD skillset including BOMs and complex surfacing.
Experience with ISO qualifications standards, especially ISO 4210.
Familiarity with welding, metal forming, machining, assembly, and/or heat treatment processes from either a shop-tech or engineering perspective.
Familiarity with Chinese language and business customs.

job_description:
Job Description
Join the Clean Energy Revolution
Become a Senior Administrative Assistant at Southern California Edison (SCE) and build a better tomorrow. In this job, you’ll support the Land & Forest Management team, responsible for oversight of company-owned land and land rights for electrical infrastructure assets, inclusive of acquisition, management and disposition. In addition, the team is responsible for governance of land and land right title, valuation, and land surveying. This is in addition to our team’s management of forest land holdings in Shaver Lake and the operations of our campground, Camp Edison.
As a Senior Administrative Assistant, your work will help power our planet, reduce carbon emissions and create cleaner air for everyone. Are you ready to take on the challenge to help us build the future?
A day in the life - Get ready to think big, work smart and shine bright!
Providing administrative support for the principal manager and senior management team
Schedule meetings, project support, document and presentation preparation
Support the team through creation of work orders and generating reports on the work order process
Administrative coordination of internal quality assurance and process controls
Direct internal and external customer correspondences to appropriate person/department (e.g. billing, logistics, offline support, etc.) including handling confidential and sensitive telephone calls, files, documents, and reports.
Manage multiple project and manager calendars, including scheduling and coordinating meetings, and conference calls for project and management staff.
File electronic and paper documents, including processing invoices, contracts, supply orders, purchase requests, ledgers, and expense reports.
Process incoming information and update department databases as the need arises while generating reports and preparing documents and materials using MS Word, MS Excel, and PowerPoint.
Order supplies and equipment, submit and track repair and maintenance orders.
Serves as a back up to other administrative support in the region as needed.
Maintain a safety conscious work environment.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.
Qualifications
The essentials
Three or more years of experience performing administrative or office management functions
Two or more years of experience with Microsoft Office (Outlook, Word, Excel, Powerpoint)
The preferred
Bachelor’s Degree
Experience using SAP systems
Strong oral and written communication skills, including document editing and presentation development
Experience with Microsoft Excel performing advanced functions such as VLOOKUP’s, pivot tables, filtering/sorting, charts and graphing.
Compiled information and entered data into computer applications.
Performed with minimal supervision, worked well under pressure to meet changing deadlines, and possess excellent organizational skills.
Processed purchase request, contracts, and invoices.
You should know ...
Work Mode: When a return-to-office date has been determined, this position’s work mode is hybrid. The employee will report to an SCE facility for a set number of days with the option to work remotely on the remaining days. Unless otherwise noted, employees are required to reside in the state of California. Further details of this work mode will be discussed at the interview stage.

About Southern California Edison
The people at SCE don't just keep the lights on. Our mission is so much bigger. We’re fueling the kind of innovation that’s changing an entire industry, and quite possibly the planet. Join us and create a future with cleaner energy, while providing our customers with the safety and reliability they demand. At SCE, you’ll have a chance to grow personally and professionally, making a real impact in Southern California and around the world.

summary: Attends functional trials to review part design changes for potential customer and manufacturing concerns, and coordinates with design engineers, (NTC and NTC…
job_description:
Life at Nissan encompasses everything that inspires both the quality of our vehicles and the quality of our people. Company-wide, you'll find fast learners and self-starting engines as well as people who are quick to embrace change and take an idea into overdrive. At Nissan, minds race. Imagination gets a green light. Each opportunity is the fuel that drives an idea from inspiration to real-life.

Job Summary
Provides engineering support for the development, production, and quality of new and current manufactured vehicles within assigned area at NNA manufacturing plants. Communicates with suppliers, manufacturing plants, and other Nissan affiliates to propose and implement countermeasures for quality, manufacturing, and field concerns within assigned area. Assists manufacturing plants and suppliers in identifying cost saving methods while improving quality.

Contributes to building brand value and achieving enduring profitable growth.

Job Functions
Communicates with suppliers to ensure assigned parts meet Nissan quality standards; reviews supplier's assembly and offers improvement suggestions; works with suppliers to eliminate repetitive quality concerns and establish permanent countermeasures; rates suppliers based on response to quality issues.
Produces and maintains equipment and manufacturing process sheets describing installation of assigned parts; determines and approves optimum process equipment for assigned area; reviews and updates process sheets or inspection standards for part changes or manufacturing concerns within assigned area; conducts cost studies for new processes or equipment; performs audits in assigned area to resolve any open issues.
Analyzes various quality and warranty reports to investigate production and customer satisfaction concerns; determines root cause and assists in developing solutions; ensures countermeasures are successfully adopted.
Attends functional trials to review part design changes for potential customer and manufacturing concerns, and coordinates with design engineers, (NTC and NTC-NA) to resolve design concerns; conducts engineering trials on new model launches to identify equipment and part fit issues; participates in plant trial for current and new models to develop and improve material and process aids or new process equipment.
Works with suppliers to ensure required or recommended design changes do not have a negative impact on quality or manufacturing process; communicates any concerns attributed to parts design or recommended changes to NTC-NA and NTC personnel to improve part function and fit; recommends design changes which would lower cost and aid in manufacturing of parts for new and existing models; implements design notes including functional approvals, new part approval, and final authorization for initiating shipping.
Provides support for new model launches by developing tooling specifications, conducting trials, and following production and quality concerns in assigned area; represents assigned area during new model development trials in Japan and U.S.; provides new vehicle information and system training for new quality inspection items.
Assists in trouble-shooting quality concerns and equipment or tooling problems in assigned area; recommends tooling modifications as required; submits and follows-up on purchase requisitions and work orders required to set up and maintain production in assigned area. Reviews and becomes thoroughly knowledgeable about current model Dispersion Control (DCC) and process control parameters within assigned area; monitors data to recommend corrective action and implement changes to process as required.
Reviews part, sub-assembly and complete body or system layout data for potential countermeasures for improvement of quality.
As necessary, performs other related duties of which the above are representative.

Minimum Qualifications

Job Knowledge and Skill:
Must meet requirements for MR1 level or possess equivalent experience. Basic knowledge of assigned areas; process equipment and flow knowledge. Excellent verbal, written communication, and problem solving skills. Working knowledge of quality control assessment such as statistical process control. Ability to understand part, sub-assembly or system dimensional layouts.

Experience:
Two to three years of related experience at a professional level, preferred.

Education:
A four-year degree in Engineering, Industrial Technology or Engineering Technology.

Computer Skills:
Thorough computer knowledge such as word processor, spreadsheet, other PC applications, or mainframe applications to resolve complex problems in day to day situations.

Physical Requirements

Travel:
Occasional day or overnight travel, including international travel. Extended travel may be required if assigned to new programs.

job_description:
Deputy Communications Director/Press Secretary – Program Manager III
The Department of Conservation and Recreation (DCR) is the largest landowner in the state, managing close to 500,000 acres of property in the majority of the 351 cities and towns in the Bay State, including parks, forests, beaches, historic sites, reservoirs, watersheds, campgrounds, dams, and recreational facilities. DCR’s mission is to protect, promote and enhance these natural, cultural and leisure resources for the well-being of all
The Press Secretary will be a core member of the organization’s Communication’s team ensuring that DCR’s objectives and achievements are communicated effectively to the media and the public through strong messaging. Reporting to and partnering with the Director of Communications, the Press Secretary will focus on media outreach including responding to media inquiries, pitching stories, distributing, press releases and media advisories, managing press events, and attending public meetings.
The Press Secretary is a strong writer who will draft press releases, traffic advisories, media advisories, and other press materials; help create and maintain an editorial calendar; draft/edit copy for DCR publications, brochures, letters, newsletters, and other materials; research topics for talking points; compile daily press clips and circulate to DCR staff.
The agency’s Press Secretary will generate and schedule social media postings on a regular basis, as well as update the Department’s website with press releases and advisories; and be assigned other duties involving media outreach and overall messaging.
Respond to media inquiries, and conduct research outreach. 30%
Draft media responses in partnership with the Director of Communications by conferring with agency staff to gather needed information and determine best way to message it; check with Director of Communications and/or Deputy Commissioner to ensure accuracy of response; make recommendations about granting interviews with Agency staff and site visits. Reach out to local newspapers and regional cable access channels to highlight DCR’s community events and accomplishment, ribbon cuttings and other ceremonies.
Written Communications: 30%
Compiles, drafts and edits various DCR publications, external / internal communications and written materials including newsletters, letters to publications, op-eds, remarks, brochures, training manuals, newsletters and various general correspondence including Commissioner’s Communication, DCR Weekly Report, and Commissioner’s Correspondence. Draft and edit press releases, statements and remarks. Assemble presentations. Ensure that these communications are well written, professional, and consistent with DCR’s message. Work with Director of Communications to determine appropriate language.
Coordinate with the Director of Communications on implementing the DCR Agency Press Strategy 20%
Works closely with the Director of Communications and staff within the Office of External Affairs and Partnerships to keep track of Agency initiatives and accomplishments. Helps create, and maintains, carry out initiatives in timely, effective and well-ordered fashion. When appropriate, pitch stories and interviews to individual reporters.
Digital Social Strategy & Execution 15%
Manages overall digital social strategy of the Agency by leading the content development and schedules of social media postings on a regular basis, as well as updates the Department’s website with press releases and advisories.
Produces News Clips 5%
Keeps abreast of all local news for stories about DCR or related matters. Daily, compiles news stories for distribution to DCR staff; maintain press clipping database.

Qualifications
MINIMUM ENTRANCE REQUIREMENTS:


Applicants must have at least (A) four (4) years of full-time or, equivalent part-time, professional, professional internship, administrative, supervisory, or managerial experience in: business administration, business management, public administration, public management, clinical administration or clinical management or (B) any equivalent combination of the required experience and substitutions below.


Substitutions:


I. A certificate in a relevant or related field may be substituted for one (1) year of the required experience.


II. An Associate’s degree in a related field may be substituted for one (1) year of the required experience.


III. A Bachelor’s degree in a related field may be substituted for two (2) years of the required experience.


IV. A Graduate degree in a related field may be substituted for three (3) years of the required experience.


V. A Doctorate degree in a related field may be substituted for the required experience.

Details relating to demonstrating compliance with this requirement will be provided to applicants selected for employment. Applicants who receive an offer of employment who can provide documentation that the vaccine is medically contraindicated or who object to vaccination due to a sincerely held religious belief may make a request for exemption.

summary:
This position exists to provide MSU Denver with a clear, comprehensive, and accurate transfer equivalency database.
This position is funded for three years.
job_description:
This position exists to provide MSU Denver with a clear, comprehensive, and accurate transfer equivalency database. To enhance speed and quality of transfer evaluations a robust and accurate equivalency database is required. This position supports the maintenance of the existing database and provides proactive equivalency research. This position works closely with the Office of Admission to support the prospective transfer student equivalency website as well as close collaboration with faculty to create more transfer equivalencies and guidelines for equivalency creation. This position is funded for three years. This position reports directly to the Assistant Registrar of Transfer Evaluation & Prior Learning Assessment.

IND208
Duties/Responsibilities
35%- Reviewing & Updating Equivalencies
The Transfer Equivalency Specialist works with the entire Registrar’s Office Transfer Team to support the updating of the transfer equivalency database that is housed in the Banner student information system. Curricular and policy changes over time have led to a need for a comprehensive review of the transfer equivalency data to ensure that students receive the most complete and accurate transfer evaluation. This position also helps to support the Colorado Community College System course renumbering starting in summer 2022.

40% –Proactive Building
The Transfer Equivalency Specialist will work closely with MSU Denver faculty to create and maintain transfer equivalency creation guidelines, known as ACME. These guidelines allow for the Transfer Evaluation team to analyze incoming transfer course descriptions to the MSU Denver course descriptions and the key course outcomes listed in each guideline. If the course meets these guidelines the Transfer Team will assign the MSU Denver equivalent course or appropriate requirement fulfillment. Using these guidelines the Transfer Equivalency Specialist will investigate the course catalogs of MSU Denver’s top transfer institution to build transfer equivalencies.

15%-Manage Prospective Student Transfer Tool
 MSU Denver utilizes a prospect transfer student advising tool. Students can enter their transfer course information to this tool to see how their courses might transfer to MSU Denver. If a student does not get a match their course information is saved so that the Transfer Equivalency Specialist can work with faculty to create an equivalency for the unmatched course. This position works closely with the Office of Admissions to update the prospective transfer advising and information. This position also works with ITS to create the monthly export report used to update the prospective advising tool.

10% – Other
Performs other duties as assigned.
Required Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree.
Minimum of three years of working in Higher Education with a minimum of two years experience in evaluating academic transcripts.
Experience working with Banner or a related student information system.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working in a Registrar’s Office.
In-depth knowledge of University course catalogs.
Strong oral and written communication skills.
Strong interpersonal skills and the ability to work effectively with others.
Experience working with articulation agreements.
Experience working with diverse and urban populations, including but not limited to communities of color, under-represented groups, LGBTQIA+, first-generation, undocumented, veterans, etc.
Work Hours
Monday through Friday 8am to 5pm
Hybrid/remote working options are available, this position will not be 100% remote

NSA is home to the largest and most established in-house research organizations within the U.S. Intelligence Community (IC), employing scientists with world-class skills in fields such as mathematics, physics, computer science, engineering, and cybersecurity. We collaborate with leading industries, universities, and national laboratories to advance core competencies, leverage work in overlapping disciplines, and solve some of the most challenging national security problems thought to be intractable by adversaries and commercial industry.
Specifically, at the Laboratory for Physical Sciences (LPS), our employees have incredible opportunities to work on revolutionary projects that will shape the future of computing. We look for people who have bold new ideas, courage and a pioneering spirit to join forces to invent that future, and have fun along the way. Our culture thrives on intellectual curiosity, cognitive diversity and bringing your whole self to work - we have an insatiable drive to do what others think is impossible. Our employees make history.
LPS is researching high performance computing systems to meet mission demands for a decade and beyond. The qualified individual will join our team to advance development of large-scale high performance computing systems with a focus on computer architectures, processing/memory subsystems, and transform computing beyond Moore's Law. You will work in a fast-paced team environment alongside physicists, engineers, computer scientists, and systems architects to make advanced processing solutions a reality.
The ideal candidate will have the ability to work with an integrated product team of diverse engineers to improve, and develop cryogenic engineering processes and have the desire and experience to direct design, fabrication, implementation, and commissioning of vacuum cryostats, magnets, and other experimental cryogenic systems as well as develop innovative solutions to improve and extend cryogenic engineering activities.
As a Cryogenic Engineer your responsibilities will include:
- Directing and organizing cryogenic system design, fabrication, assembly, and implementation;
- Directing and organizing integration of cryostat subsystems including cooling systems, current leads, ultra-high-vacuum (UHV) , magnets, shielding, vibration and other support elements;
- Directing and organizing the performance of safety evaluations involving pressure, cryogenic, and other fluid systems typically encountered in SCU installations;
- Managing and supporting test development activities for cryogenic systems;
- Identifying research challenges.
Job Summary
As an Engineering and Physical Science professional, you will use your skills to create the systems and tools that will be used to enhance the operation of intelligence. You will advise, administer and perform scientific projects, such as planning, designing, and constructing specialized equipment, and ensuring adherence to sound engineering and scientific standards and principles. The NSA offers multiple areas of focus for facilities engineers, including computer, architectural, electrical, mechanical, and structural. In addition, we are seeking skills that include computer design, microelectronics, radio frequency design, and systems engineering. Apply your science and engineering skills to protect the nation.
Qualifications
Salary Range: $74,682 - $93,062 (Entry/Developmental)
*The qualifications listed are the minimum acceptable to be considered for the position. Salary offers are based on candidates' education level and years of experience relevant to the position and also take into account information provided by the hiring manager/organization regarding the work level for the position.
With a professional Engineering degree, entry is with a Bachelor's degree and no experience.
With a degree in either (1) Physics or Astronomy from an accredited college or university or (2) a relevant professional technical field (e.g. chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, geology), entry is with a Bachelor's degree plus 1 year of relevant experience.
For all of the above degrees, if program is not ABET EAC accredited, it must include specified coursework.*
*Specified coursework includes courses in differential and integral calculus and 5 of the following 18 areas: (a) statics or dynamics, (b) strength of materials/stress-strain relationships, (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics, (d) thermodynamics, (e) electromagnetic fields, (f) nature and properties of materials/relating particle and aggregate structure to properties, (g) solid state electronics, (h) microprocessor applications, (i), computer systems, (j) signal processing, (k) digital design, (l) systems and control theory, (m) circuits or generalized circuits, (n) communication systems, (o) power systems, (p) computer networks, (q) software development, (r) Any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, or soil mechanics.
Relevant experience must be performing professional engineering or physical sciences work and/or conducting academic or independent research in a technical field (e.g., mathematics, engineering, cognitive sciences and physical sciences). Experience on polymath projects (requiring multiple skills), technical publications, patent applications, and teaching are preferred.

With a degree in either (1) Physics or Astronomy from an accredited college or university or (2) a relevant professional technical field (e.g. chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, geology), entry is with a Bachelor's degree plus 3 years of relevant experience, or a Master's or Doctoral degree plus 1 year of relevant experience.

Degree must be in either (1) professional Engineering, (2) Physics or Astronomy from an accredited college or (3) a relevant professional technical field (e.g. chemistry, architecture, computer science, mathematics, hydrology, geology).
For all of the above degrees, if program is not ABET EAC accredited, it must include specified coursework.*
*Specified coursework includes courses in differential and integral calculus and 5 of the following 18 areas: (a) statics or dynamics, (b) strength of materials/stress-strain relationships, (c) fluid mechanics, hydraulics, (d) thermodynamics, (e) electromagnetic fields, (f) nature and properties of materials/relating particle and aggregate structure to properties, (g) solid state electronics, (h) microprocessor applications, (i), computer systems, (j) signal processing, (k) digital design, (l) systems and control theory, (m) circuits or generalized circuits, (n) communication systems, (o) power systems, (p) computer networks, (q) software development, (r) Any other comparable area of fundamental engineering science or physics, such as optics, heat transfer, or soil mechanics.

Experience on polymath projects (requiring multiple skills), technical publications, patent applications, and teaching are preferred.
Competencies
The ideal candidate is someone with excellent problem-solving, communication, and interpersonal skills who is able to:
- Lead research in developing cryogenic solutions
- Implement new thermal management technologies
- Develop analytical models to predict thermal performance of cryogenic systems
- Develop interface specifications between payloads and cryogenic systems
- Design, develop, and perform testing on payloads operating in cryogenic environments
- Understand experimental design to gather desired data
Knowledge and experience in one or more of the following is desired:
- Cryogenic control systems, cryogenic system implementation, commissioning, and operation
- Safe cryogenic engineering practices including pressure, cryogenic, and oxygen deficiency hazards
- Wet and/or dry cryogenic systems
- Liquid helium and sub-Kelvin systems
- Knowledge of thermal analysis software (COMSOL, IcePak, Sinda/Fluint) or similar platforms
- Mechanical design/modeling/simulation using industry standard tools
- LabVIEW or similar acquisition software
